title: Emergency Damages I
prompt:

Shannon files a claim with her insurance company for the damage.

output_text: Yes. The explanation is as follows: "Hot Work" insurance typically protects against damage to personal property from work that involves the use of heat. Smoking a cigarette and dropping it onto a flammable substance is typically considered "work involving heat" and falls within the scope of the insurance coverage.
